medical_history.chief_complaint: Periumbilical pain, bloating/distention, and slight nausea for 12 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 12 hours prior to presentation, described as gradual in onset, crampy in quality, and moderate in severity. Pain is located in the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and is aggravated by palpation. The patient also notes subjective fevers and chills at home.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Acute colitis diagnosed 1 month ago on colonoscopy; Non-Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus (NIDDM).
